definition: scheduled flight/flight number/plane/scheduled sailing/sailing number/passenger ship

sentences.english: In Los Angeles you need to take a connecting flight to New York.
sentences.chinese: 在洛杉矶您需要转乘中转联程航班到纽约。

sentences.english: Can I check in here for the Air France flight to Paris?
sentences.chinese: 我乘法航班机飞往巴黎，能在这里检票吗？

sentences.english: AF Flight No.123 is checking in at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 法航123号航班正在办理登机手续。

sentences.english: Shanghai provides direst flights to more than 60 cities in the world.
sentences.chinese: 上海的国际航班可直达全国上60多座都会。

sentences.english: Now I have to take a later flight.
sentences.chinese: 现在我只好坐晚一般的航班了。

sentences.english: This flight is served by Boeing-737.
I anticipate the 17: 45 account is acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 我想那趟17点45分的航班很合适。
你的航班什么时候着陆？

sentences.english: On Thursday only 168 flights passed through Gatwick.
sentences.chinese: 周四，只有168架航班通过盖特维克机场。

sentences.english: This year the Indian government gave the company the go-ahead to start international service.
sentences.chinese: 今年印度政府对该公司开放了国际航班的业务。
第1095号航班立即要着陆了。

sentences.english: The flight was forced to land in Russia due to mis-entry.
sentences.chinese: 航班因为误闯而被迫降俄罗斯。

sentences.english: So we got the next flight out.
sentences.chinese: 于是我们便搭上了下一部航班。

sentences.english: Dozens of flights to and from the Twin Cities have been canceled.
sentences.chinese: 双子城的几十次往返航班都被取消。

sentences.english: Tell that to the passengers of Air China Flight 1894.
sentences.chinese: 告诉那些乘坐中国航空1894航班的乘客们。

definition: (of an airline) to run a flight
Air China (abbr. for 中國國際航空公司|中国国际航空公司[Zhong1 guo2 Guo2 ji4 Hang2 kong1 Gong1 si1])
grade/class number (in school)/flight or run number/flight or run (seen as an item)/shift (work period)
